gw.plugin.policy

Interface IPolicySystemNotificationPlugin

  • All Superinterfaces:
    com.guidewire.pl.system.integration.plugins.internal.InternalPlugin, java.rmi.Remote

    public interface IPolicySystemNotificationPlugin
extends com.guidewire.pl.system.integration.plugins.internal.InternalPlugin
    Plugin used to notify a policy system of policy related events in ClaimCenter. This plugin interface will grow in future releases as more policy system notifications are added to ClaimCenter.

    Notifications are typically implemented via an event. The full sequence is:

    • The code that identifies the notification condition creates an event
    • Event messaging rules detect the event and add a message for the PolicySystemNotificationMessageTransport
    • The PolicySystemNotificationMessageTransport reads the message and calls this plugin to actually deliver the notification to the policy system.
    Using messaging ensures that notifications are delivered reliably. If a call to this plugin fails due to network problems then the messaging layer can retry the message.

    This plugin is separate from IPolicySearchAdapter, a plugin used to search the policy system for policies when entering a new claim into the system. Policy searching uses a separate plugin because

    • The IPolicySearchAdapter has been present in all releases of ClaimCenter, so changing its interface would make upgrade difficult for existing customers.
    • The IPolicySearchAdapter must execute synchronously (rather than using asynchronous messaging) because it is used to provide the end user with immediate search results.
    Notification methods take a unique transaction id as a parameter. This id can be used by the remote system to avoid processing the same notification twice. For example, suppose ClaimCenter sends a notification and the remote system processes it but the reply back to ClaimCenter is lost due to a network failure. In this case ClaimCenter will not know that the notification was successfully delivered and will retry, using the same transaction id. The remote system can detect that it has already processed a notification with this transaction id, and throw PolicySystemAlreadyExecutedException. ClaimCenter will catch this exception and mark the message as successfully delivered.

    Nearly all operations in the plugin can throw PolicySystemRetryableException or PolicySystemAlreadyExecutedException. Typically the plugin will be talking to a remote system via SOAP, and PolicySystemRetryableException is used to indicate a temporary problem contacting the remote system. PolicySystemAlreadyExecutedException is used (as described above) if the remote system has already processed a notification. Note that if you implement this plugin using a web service you will have to wrap any exceptions thrown by the web service. The web service will throw exceptions specific to its WSDL so you will have to do something like: 

       try {
     ... call web service ...
   } catch (e : ...web service exception...) {
     throw new gw.plugin.policy.PolicySystemRetryableException(e.message)
   }

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void claimExceedsLargeLossThreshold(java.util.Date lossDate, java.lang.String policyNumber, java.lang.String grossTotalIncurred, java.lang.String transactionId)
      Report a policy against which a claim has incurred losses past the configured threshold.

    • Method Detail

      • claimExceedsLargeLossThreshold

        void claimExceedsLargeLossThreshold(java.util.Date lossDate,
                                    java.lang.String policyNumber,
                                    java.lang.String grossTotalIncurred,
                                    java.lang.String transactionId)
                             throws PolicySystemRetryableException,
                                    PolicySystemAlreadyExecutedException
        Report a policy against which a claim has incurred losses past the configured threshold. The thresholds are stored in the LargeLossThreshold reference table.
        Parameters:
        lossDate - the loss date of the claim
        policyNumber - the number of the policy
        grossTotalIncurred - the total incurred
        transactionId - a unique string identifying this particular notification
        Throws:
        PolicySystemRetryableException - if there is a retryable error while contacting the policy system
        PolicySystemAlreadyExecutedException - if the policy system has already processed a large loss notification with the same transactionId
